channel.title: Blizzards 3rd Project
channel.description:
Talking to Gamasutra, Frank Pearce, founding member and senior vice president of product development for Blizzard revealed that the company has a third team hard at work on a new title, separate from World of Warcraft and StarCraft II. The comment came amid discussion of the company's current workforce. "Our global headcount is 2,700," said Pearce, "And most of that is customer service for World of Warcraft! In terms of development staff it’s probably around 350. World of Warcraft is about 135 people, 40 for Starcraft II, 40 for team 3, our cinematics team is about 85 guys. Then there’s sound and Q/A and that sort of thing." When pressed for details regarding the new project, Pearce was cagey. "Team 3 is working on something really awesome. I can’t give you any hints, but it’s totally awesome." All attempts to extract additional information were understandably met with looks of shock and horror from Blizzard's director of global public relations, who also attended the meeting. Gamasutra was able to confirm that, in spite of Rob Pardo's comments at Hollywood and Games that they weren't giving up on StarCraft Ghost, this Blizzard project remains something different. With Blizzcon coming up in mere weeks, it's possible that additional information could be revealed at that time.
Well I hope its Diablo 3.. I guess we will have to wait until Blizzcon at August 3rd.. [i]Source[/i] http://www.gamasutra.com/php-bin/news_index.php?story=14691

See, I love the Diablo story lines… And I want it to continue…
[/quote]

Tis a valid point. But I’d just as well like to see a possibly even better one.[/quote]

Well that is going to be very hard to pull off… There going to have to base it off another good book…

item.title: Blizzards 3rd Project
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:2, topic:124014”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=173877.msg1603317#msg1603317 date=1184653695]

[quote]Talking to Gamasutra, Frank Pearce, founding member and senior vice president of product development for Blizzard revealed that the company has a third team hard at work on a new title, separate from World of Warcraft and StarCraft II.

The comment came amid discussion of the company’s current workforce. “Our global headcount is 2,700,” said Pearce, “And most of that is customer service for World of Warcraft! In terms of development staff it’s probably around 350. World of Warcraft is about 135 people, 40 for Starcraft II, 40 for team 3, our cinematics team is about 85 guys. Then there’s sound and Q/A and that sort of thing.”

When pressed for details regarding the new project, Pearce was cagey. “Team 3 is working on something really awesome. I can’t give you any hints, but it’s totally awesome.”

All attempts to extract additional information were understandably met with looks of shock and horror from Blizzard’s director of global public relations, who also attended the meeting.

Gamasutra was able to confirm that, in spite of Rob Pardo’s comments at Hollywood and Games that they weren’t giving up on StarCraft Ghost, this Blizzard project remains something different. With Blizzcon coming up in mere weeks, it’s possible that additional information could be revealed at that time.[/quote]

Well I hope its Diablo 3… I guess we will have to wait until Blizzcon at August 3rd…

Source

gamasutra.com

E3 Exclusive: Blizzard Establishes Third Team, New Game Expected

Talking to Gamasutra, Frank Pearce, founding member and senior vice president of product development for Blizzard has revealed that the company has a third team hard at work on a new title, separate from World of Warcraft and StarCraft II .


[/quote]

Wow, there are so many things going on my birthday, blizzcon,3 different movies, and a parade in my town =].[/quote]

Come on, work on the quoting skills. Btw, I really don’t hope its D3. Maybe they’ll come up with a better game thats BETTER.
